TopicTitle: Asymmetric thrust, FAR, and another intriguing question.

Articles.Content:
Hello there.

I'd like to know how does one set up asymmetric thrust properly.

Thing is, I'm doing a plane and the best (aesthetically speaking) place that I can put the engine is not aligned with the CoM.

Help me and rep-flavored cookies will be given to you ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif).

I don"t want to be this annoying guy, but there is this mod for you : [Throttle Controlled Avionics](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107802)

I use it and I love it. It does exactly what you are asking for !

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I don"t want to be this annoying guy, but there is this mod for you : [Throttle Controlled Avionics](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107802)
> I use it and I love it. It does exactly what you are asking for !

otherwise you could just tweak the thrust limiters of some engines and abuse RCS power, but that's long, tedious, hard, and cheap. !
Maybe you could try to counter the engine torque with some draggy parts placed at the right spot.

Use [RCS Build Aid](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35996-1-0-2-RCS-Build-Aid-v0-7-2) and align thrust through COM by rotating the engine slightly. OTOH, for planes it doesn't matter too much if thrust isn't aligned - provided you have enough control authority to hold level flight at full throttle. This can even be advantageous at times as it allows [control without control surfaces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_with_disabled_controls). ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Maybe you could try to counter the engine torque with some draggy parts placed at the right spot.

Yes, that's what I'm planning to do: align the wings and engine in a way so that the torque gets countered.

Does anyone know how to find that alignment?
